intro: Ixora guillotii, commonly known as the Madagascar flame or flame ixora, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. Ixora guillotii typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green in color.
